abstract: Britain has formally left the European Union, but difficult trade talks remain before the two are severed.
lead_paragraph: Finally, after 1,317 days of confusion, rancor and endless votes in Parliament, it was time for Brexit. On Wednesday, teary members of the European Parliament joined hands and sang “Auld Lang Syne,” a clock projected onto 10 Downing Street counted down the minutes, Union Jacks lined the Mall before Buckingham Palace.
